_header: Of each manner evil whatever it be
Subjects: introductions, to prose texts; evils of the time
_description: A rhyming opening (seven lines of which four are couplets) to a prose tract

CamStJohn37.Transcription:
Of eyche maner euyl what eyuer yt besone here aftyr þu myȝt
                    seeman or woman þat hath naturehow þu schalt take eny
                    hedenow þu may take gud hedehow þu myȝt thy body
                    ȝeueeueryche man best & worst
CamStJohn37.Note:
Seven lines introducing prose tract, some of which rhyme: possibly
                    prosified version of rhyming opening; note correction from Brown  and  Robbins (1943)
XCarleton Fairchild Brown,   and  Rossell Hope Robbins.  
             The Index of Middle English Verse.
         New York: Printed for the Index Society by Columbia University Press,
            1943: Part II, not Part III.
CamStJohn37.Attributed Title:
Ipocras thys boke send to þe emperowr of cacari whyte þu þat
                    thys boke ys gud leche with alle þyngys yt doth teyche do also thys boke
                    bedyth yt teychyt þynges to leychys al here wyt (Part II, f.
                    10v)
